content.raw:
Apologies, I mean “build” not “run.” Modifying the Dockerfile to switch to the correct branch resolves the problem. I can see this is kind of a Catch 22. Maybe there should be a comment in the file that you can uncomment to switch branches. I’d be interested to hear how you’ve been doing this.

In any case, it now builds correctly and runs on my machine with an Nvidia card. I will test the non-Nvidia version next.

One additional note which is more about Docker development--running multiple terminals to interact with Gazebo requires some non-obvious commands. I'm using `docker exec -it container_name /bin/bash`. Is that what you’ve been using?
content.html:
Apologies, I mean “build” not “run.” Modifying the Dockerfile to switch to the correct branch resolves the problem. I can see this is kind of a Catch 22. Maybe there should be a comment in the file that you can uncomment to switch branches. I’d be interested to hear how you’ve been doing this.

In any case, it now builds correctly and runs on my machine with an Nvidia card. I will test the non-Nvidia version next.

One additional note which is more about Docker development--running multiple terminals to interact with Gazebo requires some non-obvious commands. I'm using docker exec -it container_name /bin/bash. Is that what you’ve been using?
